author: ben_a_adams
content: Like PAY opcode; but clean up account tx? (No dust)

author: sky.cactus
content: Based no my cursory scan of the PAY EIP, yes.  This is just to remove all ETH from an account like when you are rotating keys.  At the moment, to do this you need to "burn" some ETH by setting priority fee equal to max fee.  This would let you sweep the account without needing to "donate" money to block producers or do some complicated delegate setup with self destruct or PAY (which also costs a bunch of extra gas).

author: _shemnon
content: I don't think we can just yolo in a new thing without making sure it has a place in a well-reasoned future of SSZ transactions.  EIP-6404 already sets up a thourough foundation, but if we just put in the simplest possible SSZ tx then it may actually hider better SSZ transactions because "we have that already"

author: _shemnon
content: So if the sweep was one of the payloads, yes. We need to make sure payloads and signatures are separated so we can iterate on signatures without having to iterate on payloads.

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm not suggesting that a sweep transaction would be transient.  I think it is a legitimate QoL improvement for Ethereum users that would live on indefinitely.  I agree with you that we should make sure to "do it right" if we do it (as you suggest, we should think hard about how we structure the payload).

author: potuz
content: I do not think you can sweep an account with a simple transfer without donating to the proposer unless you know exactly what the gas price of the block it will be mined is

author: potuz
content: even donating I do not know how that's done

author: sky.cactus
content:
The way to sweep historically is: `value: balance - 21000 * x, maxFeePerGas: x, maxPriorityFeePerGas: x`
You set `x` to last block base fee + some margin + priority fee, any excess beyond what was necessary goes to proposer.
I believe you can do it more smartly with delegates now, by delegating some code and then having some other account (that pays for gas) transfer all ETH away, or self destruct the ETH away.  I'm not sure if any such contracts exist.
